abstract: Microsoft’s MSN division is worth $10 billion, Henry Blodget calculates. That’s not enough to trade for much of Yahoo, but giving up control may be the best bet for Microsoft.
snippet: Microsoft’s MSN division is worth $10 billion, Henry Blodget calculates. That’s not enough to trade for much of Yahoo, but giving up control may be the best bet for Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: In a cross-blog dialog, I challenged Henry Blodget of Silicon Alley Insider to estimate what the MSN division is worth if Microsoft traded it to take a partial stake in Yahoo. (This was Mr. Blodget’s sensible proposed alternative to an outright purchase of Yahoo.)

headline.main: The Back of Henry Blodget’s Envelope
